overview: From 2025-05-25 to 2025-06-01, elizaos/eliza had 32 new PRs (23 merged), 5 new issues, and 17 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Eliza with twitter never initializes clients
topIssues.author: omariosman
topIssues.body:
I am trying to use Eliza with twitter, but it never initializes the clients and therefore it never publishes any tweets

This is my **.env**
https://pastebin.com/1cYQYbxe

This is my **character.json**
https://pastebin.com/

This is my **terminal output:**
https://pastebin.com/fbsJUbDX

I tried both twitter username, password and cookies as well but no luck
My twitter account has no 2FA

Any help is appreciated, thank you

topIssues.title: API /:agentId/rooms is not working
topIssues.author: standujar
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

The agents api /rooms return:

```
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "rooms": []
  }
}

```
**To Reproduce**

Run an agent, check the rooms API : http://localhost:3000/api/agents/:agentId/rooms

**Expected behavior**

We should have a list of existing registered rooms.

topIssues.title: Temporary messages not removed after failed send messages stay in UI even on error
topIssues.author: 0x-Tek

topIssues.title: API endpoint /api/agents/:agentId/rooms returns empty list despite agent being active in rooms
topIssues.author: standujar
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

The API endpoint `/api/agents/:agentId/rooms` returns an empty list of rooms `({"success":true,"data":{"rooms":[]}})` even though the agent is actively participating in multiple rooms and responding to messages in those rooms.

**To Reproduce**

Start the agent with multiple connected services _(Discord, Telegram, etc.)_
Verify the agent is responding to messages in rooms _(e.g., Discord channels)_
Call the API endpoint **GET** `/api/agents/:agentId/rooms`
Observe that the response contains an empty rooms array despite the agent being active in rooms

**Expected behavior**

The API should return a list of all rooms where the agent is a participant. For example:
```
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "rooms": [
      {
        "id": "room-id-1",
        "name": "Room Name 1",
        "source": "discord",
        ...
      },
      ...
    ]
  }
}
```

**Additional context**

- In the agent logs, there are numerous successful room creations: `Room [UUID] created successfully`
- Agent connection to rooms is also logged: Success: `Successfully connected entity [agentId] in room [roomId]`
- When a message is received and processed in a room, the agent correctly responds
- The logs show an error: `ERROR: No room found for settings provider` which might be related
- The issue appears to be in the association between the agent and rooms in the database, or in how `getRoomsForParticipant` retrieves this information
- The function that calls this API is in `eliza/packages/cli/src/server/api/agent.ts`, which delegates to `runtime.getRoomsForParticipant(agentId)` which in turn delegates to the database adapter

topPRs.author: HashWarlock
topPRs.body:
<!-- Use this template by filling in information and copying and pasting relevant items out of the HTML comments. -->

# Relates to
Adds TEE Project Starter Template for a quickstart to launch in TEE Cloud provider. For the time being, Phala Cloud is the current available option for a customizable ElizaOS deployment.
<!-- LINK TO ISSUE OR TICKET -->

<!-- This risks section must be filled out before the final review and merge. -->

# Risks
Low
<!--
Low, medium, large. List what kind of risks and what could be affected.
-->

# Background

## What does this PR do?
Creates a quick start to generate a TEE Agent project.
## What kind of change is this?
Feature
<!--
Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
Improvements (misc. changes to existing features)
Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
Updates (new versions of included code)
-->

<!-- This "Why" section is most relevant if there are no linked issues explaining why. If there is a related issue, it might make sense to skip this why section. -->
<!--
## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?
-->

# Documentation changes needed?

<!--
My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.
My changes require a change to the project documentation.
If documentation change is needed: I have updated the documentation accordingly.
-->

<!-- Please show how you tested the PR. This will really help if the PR needs to be retested and probably help the PR get merged quicker. -->

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?
A reviewer should start with getting a Phala Cloud Account to test the CVM deployment. Get an API Key and Install the Phala Cloud CLI for deployment. Check Docs [here]()
### Detailed testing steps
First clone the repo (I have not added the CLI command, yet. This could be easier with elizaos CLI.)
```bash
# Make sure you are in the `project-tee-starter` folder
npm install -g phala
# Set TEE_MODE=PRODUCTION
# Ensure you are also running docker

# Step0: Set your API Key from Phala Cloud Dashboard
phala auth login

# Step1: Build Docker Image
phala docker build

# Step2: Publish Docker Image to DockerHub
phala docker push

# Step3: Update docker-compose.yaml file with your published Docker image and deploy CVM
phala cvms create -c docker-compose.yaml -e .env

# (Optional) Step4: Check attestation
phala cvms attestation

# (Optional) Step5: Upgrade CVM if updated changes
phala cvms upgrade -c docker-compose.yaml
```
<!--
None: Automated tests are acceptable.
-->

topPRs.title: feat: Add CLI tests, add plugin dependencies, overhaul plugin registration
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR changes CLI so that plugins can have dependencies, for example the trader plugin can depend on the solana plugin, which ensures that it is installed when running tests

Some CLI tests are added

topPRs.title: feat: Migrate knowledge tab to plugin-knowledge, add graph view to memories
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR makes some changes to enable the knowledge plugin

- Some stuff could be moved out of the PR but is probably fine, like the package.json changes, and we should adopt the convention of .beta" anyways

- Removes knowledge APIs since they are in plugin-knowledge

- Adds some PCA stuff to map embeddings to a 2D graph

- Adds a graph view to memories and lib stuff for other views

topPRs.title: feat(update): Eliza290/cli-publish-command
topPRs.author: yungalgo
topPRs.body:
# 🚀 ElizaOS CLI Publish Command Overhaul

## Overview

This PR introduces comprehensive improvements to the ElizaOS CLI publish command, transforming it from a GitHub-only publishing tool into a complete publishing solution that handles npm, GitHub, and registry publishing in a single command.

## Problem Statement

The current `elizaos publish` command had several critical limitations:

### 1. **Incomplete Publishing Workflow**
- Only published to GitHub, requiring manual npm publishing
- Users had to run separate commands for complete package distribution
- No unified workflow for plugin developers

### 2. **Registry Infrastructure Issues**
- Hardcoded registry URLs throughout codebase (`elizaos/registry` → `elizaos-plugins/registry`)
- Registry publishing created massive diffs by reordering entire index.json
- Incorrect package naming with `@elizaos-plugins/` prefix instead of actual npm names
- Environment loading issues preventing GitHub token access

### 3. **Poor Developer Experience**
- Fragmented publishing process
- Inconsistent documentation across templates and docs
- No guidance on continuous development workflows
- Recursion issues when npm scripts triggered ElizaOS commands

## Solution

This PR implements a complete publishing solution through 5 focused improvements:

### 🔧 **1. Code Cleanup** 
- Remove unnecessary parenthesis for better code readability
- Minor syntax improvements

### 🏗️ **2. Registry Infrastructure Consolidation**
- **Centralized constants**: Created `packages/cli/src/utils/registry/constants.ts`
- **Updated registry URL**: Changed from `elizaos/registry` to `elizaos-plugins/registry`
- **Single source of truth**: All registry references now use centralized `REGISTRY_URL`

**Files affected:**
- `packages/cli/src/utils/registry/constants.ts` (new)
- `packages/cli/src/commands/publish.ts`
- `packages/cli/src/utils/parse-registry.ts`
- `packages/client/src/hooks/use-plugins.ts`
- `.github/workflows/plugin-publish.yml`

### 🛠️ **3. Registry Publishing Logic Fixes**
- **Correct package naming**: Use actual npm package name instead of `@elizaos-plugins/` prefix
- **Minimal diffs**: Line-by-line insertion instead of full file reordering
- **Alphabetical positioning**: Clean registry updates with proper sorting
- **Consistent indentation**: Standardized to 4 spaces
- **Conflict detection**: Added registry conflict detection and handling

### 🚀 **4. Complete npm Integration**
- **Default behavior**: `elizaos publish` now publishes to npm + GitHub + registry
- **Recursion prevention**: Uses `--ignore-scripts` to prevent infinite loops
- **Flag restructure**: `--npm` now means "npm only" (skip GitHub and registry)
- **Environment fixes**: Added dotenv support to `parse-registry.ts` for GitHub token access
- **Authentication flow**: Integrated npm login requirements into publish workflow

**BREAKING CHANGE**: `elizaos publish` now publishes to npm by default

### 📚 **5. Comprehensive Documentation Updates**
- **Updated CLI README**: Reflects new npm + GitHub + registry default behavior
- **Enhanced publish.md**: Added continuous development workflows and testing guidance
- **Plugin starter templates**: Updated with complete publishing and development workflows
- **Success messaging**: Added guidance for future updates using standard npm/git workflows
- **Testing integration**: Emphasized testing throughout development lifecycle

## Key Features

### 🎯 **Unified Publishing Command**
```bash
# One command does everything (recommended)
elizaos publish

# npm only (for private packages)
elizaos publish --npm

# Skip registry submission
elizaos publish --skip-registry
```

### 🔄 **Proper Continuous Development**
After initial publish, developers use standard workflows:
```bash
npm version patch|minor|major  # Update version
npm publish                    # Publish to npm
git push origin main           # Update GitHub
git push --tags               # Push version tags
```

### 🧪 **Enhanced Testing Integration**
```bash
elizaos test                   # Run all tests
elizaos publish --test         # Test publish process
elizaos publish --dry-run      # Generate registry files locally
```

## Technical Implementation

### Registry URL Migration
- **Before**: `elizaos/registry` (hardcoded in multiple files)
- **After**: `elizaos-plugins/registry` (centralized constant)

### Publishing Flow
1. **Authentication**: npm login + GitHub token validation
2. **Building**: `npm run build`
3. **npm Publishing**: `npm publish --ignore-scripts` (prevents recursion)
4. **GitHub Publishing**: Repository creation/update + registry PR submission
5. **Success Guidance**: Instructions for future updates

### Environment Loading
- Added dotenv support to registry parsing
- Proper GitHub token access from `.env` files
- Improved error handling for authentication failures

## Testing

- ✅ All existing tests pass
- ✅ New publish workflow tested with `--test` flag
- ✅ Registry publishing logic validated with `--dry-run`
- ✅ Documentation examples verified
- ✅ Recursion prevention confirmed

## Migration Guide

### For Plugin Developers
- **No action required** for existing plugins
- New plugins get improved workflow automatically
- Future updates should use standard npm/git commands

### For CLI Users
- `elizaos publish` now does complete publishing (npm + GitHub + registry)
- Use `elizaos publish --npm` for npm-only publishing
- Follow new continuous development workflows in documentation

## Files Changed

<details>
<summary>Core CLI Changes (5 files)</summary>

- `packages/cli/src/commands/publish.ts` - Main publish command logic
- `packages/cli/src/utils/registry/constants.ts` - New centralized constants
- `packages/cli/src/utils/registry/index.ts` - Registry utilities
- `packages/cli/src/utils/parse-registry.ts` - Environment loading fixes
- `packages/cli/README.md` - Updated CLI documentation
</details>

<details>
<summary>Documentation Updates (3 files)</summary>

- `packages/docs/docs/cli/publish.md` - Complete workflow documentation
- `packages/cli/templates/plugin-starter/README.md` - Template updates
- `packages/plugin-starter/README.md` - Standalone starter updates
</details>

<details>
<summary>Infrastructure Updates (3 files)</summary>

- `packages/client/src/hooks/use-plugins.ts` - Registry URL updates
- `packages/docs/scripts/update-registry.js` - Registry script updates
- `.github/workflows/plugin-publish.yml` - Workflow updates
</details>

## Related Issues

- Fixes fragmented publishing workflow
- Resolves registry URL inconsistencies  
- Addresses npm publishing recursion issues
- Improves developer experience for plugin publishing
- Standardizes continuous development workflows

## Breaking Changes

- **`elizaos publish`** now publishes to npm by default (previously GitHub only)
- **`--npm` flag** now means "npm only" instead of "include npm"
- **Registry URL** changed from `elizaos/registry` to `elizaos-plugins/registry`

topContributors.summary: 0xbbjoker: Opened one pull request (#4773) focused on image description functionality, which is still a work in progress. Made moderate code changes across 3 files (+308/-37 lines) in a single commit. Activity was limited to just one day during this period.

lalalune: Opened a significant pull request (#4766) focused on migrating the knowledge tab to plugin-knowledge and adding graph visualization, with substantial code changes (+2936/-2199 lines) across 28 files. The PR represents a major development effort, modifying primarily code (52%), configuration (23%), and test files (19%) in a single day of activity this week.
Samarthsinghal28: Merged a single PR (#4771) that fixed the "Undelegate Action" with substantial code changes (+980/-2051 lines).

imholders: Opened two documentation-related PRs this week: #4768 to delete README_MY.md and #4767 to update README.md, with modest changes totaling +1/-55 lines. Activity was limited to a single day with a focus exclusively on documentation files.

HashWarlock: Opened one PR (#4774) to add a Project TEE Starter Template, with significant code additions (+4202/-47 lines) across 41 files. Activity was concentrated on a single day, with the work primarily focused on tests (50%) and configuration files (15%).

dotslashapaar: Opened a single pull request (#4775) to correct the path for defaultCharacter.ts, making a small documentation change (+1/-1 lines). Active on only one day this week with minimal contribution.
monilpat: Provided one code review with approval this week, with no other GitHub activity observed.
standujar: Opened issue #4772 regarding "LOG_LEVEL not working" and contributed to discussions on 4 existing issues. No code changes or pull requests during this period.
K1mc4n: Opened issue #4770 "Failed Fetch-News" which remains open. No other activity this week.
0x-Tek: Opened issue #4769 regarding temporary messages not being removed after failed send messages. No other activity this week.
